moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5 4. d3 d6: Breaking out of the Italian game...
moves.9. Be3: I offer a rather hopeful exchange...
moves.9... Ba7: He doesn't want his pawns scrambled...
moves.12. Bb3 Qg6 13. Qxg6: I was divided on that. Would it have been better to play Qh4?
moves.13... hxg6: Here is why I didn't like it, it opens the h-file for the rook.
moves.14... O-O: ? It would have been better to initiate a king side attack.
moves.15. c3: I switch play to the queen side...
moves.15... b5 16. d4 a5 17. a4 b4 18. dxe5 dx: Now I have a passed pawn.
moves.25. Nxe5 f6 26. Nxc6: I exchange my way to get another passed pawn...
moves.26... Bxc6 27. Rxc6 Rxe4 28. Rb6 Rxe3 29: I now have two connected passed pawns...
moves.29... Nf5: This knight is a little late to the action...
moves.30. a6: I start to push my way to victory...
moves.30... Nd6: Find why this move is a blunder.
moves.31. Rh4#: A bolt from the blue! Shah mat! (the king is dead)
